data.meaning_mnemonic: You see a manhole <radical>lid</radical> and a <radical>towel</radical>, both with the name of a <kanji>city</kanji> on them. Decorative manhole lids and souvenir towels — two things cities love to slap their names on, especially in Japan.
data.meaning_hint: Picture this towel with the name of a city on it. Any city you like. Maybe it's your city!
data.reading_mnemonic: This <kanji>city</kanji> must have a lot of <reading>shee</reading>p (し) because, besides the manhole lid and the towel, all you can see are sheep. There are sheep everywhere. It's a sheep city.
data.reading_hint: Imagine a city that has a sheep everywhere you look, as far as the eye can see. This city was built on sheep, don't you say a bad word about sheep when you're there.
